Articles.Content:
As the title says.... Is v1.6 for Linux actually released?

I play on two different computers, one Windows, one Linux. The Window system got the update to 1.6 first, there were some complaints about mk2 Lander but it all worked out in the end.

Later that same day I went to play on my Linux system and I *thought* I had update dialog telling me about 1.6, doing upgrade, etc. I played, got the same warning about the lander and some
other parts but it worked. Then trying to play again the next day I get incompatible save errors and it won't load. I started investigating this thinking the save had been corrupted only to realize
I'm still playing 1.5.1

Now I'm wondering, did I imagine my Linux system updating? Did it revert? Is it even out?

2 hours ago, Kaphod Kerblebrox said:

As the title says.... Is v1.6 for Linux actually released?

Yes. Did you for some reason revert to 1.5.1 on the betas tab?
Don't think so, I don't get either 1.6 or 1.5.1 as an option.

The last time I wasn't able to choose any previous game version was when I was using the beta for the Steam client. Are you by any chance using the beta client for Proton? If yes: it's already included in the mainline version.

No, I do not believe I'm using the Proton Beta, that rings a bell and I might have tried getting it running...

but apt just shows I'm using steam:i386 (doesn't seem to be another option, but my actual run-time shows the KSP.x86_64 bin)
And the Steam client indicated I wasn't opt into any betas (and opting in didn't help)
 

Quote

The﻿ last time I wasn't able to choose any﻿ previous game version﻿﻿﻿﻿

To clarify, I do get old versions of the game, just neither 1.5.1 (presumably because I'm running that version) nor 1.6
Alright! Had more time to dig into this, uninstalled/reinstalled of KSP and I'm on 1.6 now.
